page.title: 14LIMEHURST HOUSE
page.content: Limehurst House is owned by the Borough Council and is occasionally rented out to Age Concern as a Community Centre for old people. The wardens name is Anne Oliver and she lives in a flat above the building. She visits the old people in her care each morning five days a week.At the weekend the relief warden Ester Hodges visits the residents.If they are not able to do their own cooking they have "Meals on Wheels". The oldest resident is Mr.Noble who is 93.One lady is off to visit Australia to see her son.She is 83. Part of the house is used as meeting place for the residents where they play Bingo and Whist.Everyone who lives there is friendly and happy.
